name: PrivacyTools
signal_source: Privacy research shows users concerned about 'permission abuse' and apps that 'collect and sell large databases of information'
description: Audit tool that analyzes installed apps' permissions and suggests privacy-friendly alternatives
target_user: Privacy-conscious users who want to understand and minimize the data exposure from their installed apps
pain_point_evidence: Users can't 'always be sure how apps will use your information or who they will share it with' and need better permission visibility
differentiation: Permission auditing vs. individual app privacy, alternative suggestions vs. just warnings
subscription_fit: Premium includes real-time monitoring, detailed reports, and family account management

pricing.trial_strategy: Free basic audit, premium for monitoring and detailed analytics
